Class JSONTreeWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • JSONTreeWriter

  • public class JSONTreeWriter
extends Object
    Utility class that outputs various Tree structures as JSON objects or arrays to file. Designed to demonstrate basic file processing and exception handling, and the JSON format. You are welcome to add additional helper methods to this class. If you go about this in a general way, there will be very little repeated copy/pasted code in this class.

    • Method Detail

      • indent

        public static String indent(int times)
                     throws IOException
        Helper method to indent several times by 2 spaces each time. For example, indent(0) will return an empty string, indent(1) will return 2 spaces, and indent(2) will return 4 spaces.

        Using this method is optional!

        Parameters:
        times -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        IOException

      • quote

        public static String quote(String text)
        Helper method to quote text for output. This requires escaping the quotation mark " as \" for use in Strings. For example: 
         String text = "hello world";
 System.out.println(text); // output: hello world
 System.out.println(quote(text)); // output: "hello world"
        Parameters:
        text - input to surround with quotation marks
        Returns:
        quoted text

      • writeObject

        public static boolean writeObject(Path output,
                                  TreeMap<String,Integer> elements)
        Writes the elements as a JSON object to the specified output path using the "UTF-8" character set. The output is in a "pretty" format with 2 spaces per indent level. 
         {
   "key1": value1,
   "key2": value2
 }

        Note that there is not a trailing space after the second value, the key should be in quotes, and this method should NOT throw an exception.

        Parameters:
        output - file to write
        elements - to write as a JSON object
        Returns:
        true if there were no problems or exceptions

      • writeArray

        public static boolean writeArray(Path output,
                                 TreeSet<Integer> elements)
        Writes the elements as a JSON array to the specified output path using the "UTF-8" character set. The output is in a "pretty" format with 2 spaces per indent level. 
         [
   value1,
   value2
 ]

        Note that there is not a trailing space after the second value, and this method should NOT throw an exception.

        Parameters:
        output - file to write
        elements - to write as a JSON array
        Returns:
        true if there were no problems or exceptions

      • writeNestedObject

        public static boolean writeNestedObject(Path output,
                                        TreeMap<String,TreeSet<Integer>> elements)
        Writes the elements as a JSON object with nested array values to the specified output path using the "UTF-8" character set. The output is in a "pretty" format with 2 spaces per indent level. 
         {
   "key1": [
     value1,
     value2
   ],
   "key2": [
     value3
   ]
 }

        Note that there is not a trailing space after the second value, the key should be in quotes, and this method should NOT throw an exception.

        Parameters:
        output - file to write
        elements - to write as a JSON array
        Returns:
        true if there were no problems or exceptions
